org.apache.juneau.rest

Class RestRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.ServletRequestWrapper
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper
        • org.apache.juneau.rest.RestRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.ServletRequest

    public final class RestRequest
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper
    Represents an HTTP request for a REST resource.

    Equivalent to HttpServletRequest except with some additional convenience methods.

    For reference, given the URL "http://localhost:9080/contextRoot/servletPath/foo?bar=baz#qux", the following methods return the following values....

    MethodValue
    getContextPath()/contextRoot
    getPathInfo()/foo
    getPathTranslated()path-to-deployed-war-on-filesystem/foo
    getQueryString()bar=baz
    getRequestURI()/contextRoot/servletPath/foo
    getRequestURL()http://localhost:9080/contextRoot/servletPath/foo
    getServletPath()/servletPath
    See Also:
    • Overview > juneau-rest-server > @RestMethod > RestRequest

      • getProperties

        public RequestProperties getProperties()
        Retrieve the properties active for this request.

        This contains all resource and method level properties from the following:

        • RestResource.properties()
        • RestMethod.properties()
        • RestContextBuilder.set(String, Object)

        The returned object is modifiable and allows you to override session-level properties before they get passed to the serializers.
        However, properties are open-ended, and can be used for any purpose.

        Example:

        @RestMethod( properties={ @Property(name=SERIALIZER_sortMaps, value="false") } ) public Map doGet(RestRequest req, @Query("sortMaps") Boolean sortMaps) { // Override value if specified through query parameter. if (sortMaps != null) req.getProperties().put(SERIALIZER_sortMaps, sortMaps); return getMyMap(); }

        See Also:
        • prop(String, Object)
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > Properties
        Returns:
        The properties active for this request.

      • prop

        public RestRequest prop(String name,
                        Object value)
        Shortcut for calling getProperties().append(name, value); fluently.
        Parameters:
        name - The property name.
        value - The property value.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • getHeaders

        public RequestHeaders getHeaders()
        Request headers.

        Returns a RequestHeaders object that encapsulates access to HTTP headers on the request.

        Example:

        @RestMethod(...) public Object myMethod(RestRequest req) { // Get access to headers. RequestHeaders h = req.getHeaders(); // Add a default value. h.addDefault("ETag", DEFAULT_UUID); // Get a header value as a POJO. UUID etag = h.get("ETag", UUID.class); // Get a standard header. CacheControl = h.getCacheControl(); }

        Notes:
        • This object is modifiable.
        • Values are converted from strings using the registered part-parser on the resource class.
        • The RequestHeaders object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
        • The @Header annotation can be used to access individual header values.
        See Also:
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > @RestMethod > RequestHeaders
        Returns:
        The headers on this request.
        Never null.

      • getQuery

        public RequestQuery getQuery()
        Query parameters.

        Returns a RequestQuery object that encapsulates access to URL GET parameters.

        Similar to ServletRequestWrapper.getParameterMap() but only looks for query parameters in the URL and not form posts.

        Example:

        @RestMethod(...) public void doGet(RestRequest req) { // Get access to query parameters on the URL. RequestQuery q = req.getQuery(); // Get query parameters converted to various types. int p1 = q.get("p1", 0, int.class); String p2 = q.get("p2", String.class); UUID p3 = q.get("p3", UUID.class); }

        Notes:
        • This object is modifiable.
        • This method can be used to retrieve query parameters without triggering the underlying servlet API to load and parse the request body.
        • Values are converted from strings using the registered part-parser on the resource class.
        • The RequestQuery object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
        • The @Query annotation can be used to access individual query parameter values.
        See Also:
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > @RestMethod > RequestQuery
        Returns:
        The query parameters as a modifiable map.
        Never null.

      • getQuery

        public String getQuery(String name)
        Shortcut for calling getQuery().getString(name).
        Parameters:
        name - The query parameter name.
        Returns:
        The query parameter value, or null if not found.

      • getFormData

        public RequestFormData getFormData()
                            throws InternalServerError
        Form-data.

        Returns a RequestFormData object that encapsulates access to form post parameters.

        Similar to ServletRequestWrapper.getParameterMap(), but only looks for form data in the HTTP body.

        Example:

        @RestMethod(...) public void doPost(RestRequest req) { // Get access to parsed form data parameters. RequestFormData fd = req.getFormData(); // Get form data parameters converted to various types. int p1 = fd.get("p1", 0, int.class); String p2 = fd.get("p2", String.class); UUID p3 = fd.get("p3", UUID.class); }

        Notes:
        • This object is modifiable.
        • Values are converted from strings using the registered part-parser on the resource class.
        • The RequestFormData object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
        • The @FormDAta annotation can be used to access individual form data parameter values.
        See Also:
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > @RestMethod > RequestFormData
        Returns:
        The URL-encoded form data from the request.
        Never null.
        Throws:
        InternalServerError - If query parameters could not be parsed.
        See Also:
        FormData

      • getFormData

        public String getFormData(String name)
        Shortcut for calling getFormData().getString(name).
        Parameters:
        name - The form data parameter name.
        Returns:
        The form data parameter value, or null if not found.

      • getPathMatch

        public RequestPath getPathMatch()
        Request path match.

        Returns a RequestPath object that encapsulates access to everything related to the URL path.

        Example:

        @RestMethod(..., path="/{foo}/{bar}/{baz}/*") public void doGet(RestRequest req) { // Get access to path data. RequestPathMatch pm = req.getPathMatch(); // Example URL: /123/qux/true/quux int foo = pm.getInt("foo"); // =123 String bar = pm.getString("bar"); // =qux boolean baz = pm.getBoolean("baz"); // =true String remainder = pm.getRemainder(); // =quux }

        Notes:
        • This object is modifiable.
        • Values are converted from strings using the registered part-parser on the resource class.
        • The RequestPath object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
        • The @Path annotation can be used to access individual values.
        See Also:
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > @RestMethod > RequestPathMatch
        Returns:
        The path data from the URL.
        Never null.

      • getPath

        public String getPath(String name)
        Shortcut for calling getPathMatch().get(name).
        Parameters:
        name - The path variable name.
        Returns:
        The path variable value, or null if not found.

      • getPathRemainder

        public String getPathRemainder()
        Shortcut for calling getPathMatch().getRemainder().
        Returns:
        The path remainder value, or null if not found.

      • getBody

        public RequestBody getBody()
        Request body.

        Returns a RequestBody object that encapsulates access to the HTTP request body.

        Example:

        @RestMethod(...) public void doPost2(RestRequest req) { // Convert body to a linked list of Person objects. List<Person> l = req.getBody().asType(LinkedList.class, Person.class); .. }

        Notes:
        • The RequestBody object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
        • The @Body annotation can be used to access the body as well.
        See Also:
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > @RestMethod > RequestBody
        Returns:
        The body of this HTTP request.
        Never null.

      • getReader

        public BufferedReader getReader()
                         throws IOException
        Returns the HTTP body content as a Reader.

        If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &body=xxx in the URL query string.

        Automatically handles GZipped input streams.

        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        getReader in class javax.servlet.ServletRequestWrapper
        Throws:

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getUri

        public URI getUri(boolean includeQuery,
                  Map<String,?> addQueryParams)
        Returns the URI for this request.

        Similar to HttpServletRequestWrapper.getRequestURI() but returns the value as a URI. It also gives you the capability to override the query parameters (e.g. add new query parameters to the existing URI).

        Parameters:
        includeQuery - If true include the query parameters on the request.
        addQueryParams - Augment the request URI with the specified query parameters.
        Returns:
        A new URI.

      • getInfoProvider

        public RestInfoProvider getInfoProvider()
        Resource information provider.

        Returns a RestInfoProvider object that encapsulates all the textual meta-data on this resource such as descriptions, titles, and Swagger documentation.

        Example:

        @RestMethod(...) public void doGet(RestRequest req) { // Get information provider. RestInfoProvider p = req.getInfoProvider(); // Get localized strings. String resourceTitle = p.getTitle(req); String methodDescription = p.getMethodDescription(req.getMethod(), req); Contact contact = p.getContact(req); .. }

        Notes:
        • The RestInfoProvider object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_infoProvider
        • RestInfoProvider
        • getSiteName()
        • getResourceTitle()
        • getResourceDescription()
        • getMethodSummary()
        • getMethodDescription()
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > Swagger
        Returns:
        The info provider on the resource.
        Never null.

      • getSwagger

        public Swagger getSwagger()
        Returns the localized swagger associated with the resource.

        A shortcut for calling getInfoProvider().getSwagger(request);

        Example:

        @RestMethod(...) public List<Tag> getSwaggerTags(RestRequest req) { return req.getSwagger().getTags(); }

        Notes:
        • The Swagger object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_infoProvider
        • RestInfoProvider
        • getInfoProvider()
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > Swagger
        Returns:
        The swagger associated with the resource.
        Never null.
        Throws:
        RestException
        InternalServerError

      • getSiteName

        public String getSiteName()
        Returns the localized site name.

        The site name is intended to be a title that can be applied to the entire site.

        One possible use is if you want to add the same title to the top of all pages by defining a header on a common parent class like so:

        htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( header={ "<h1>$R{siteName}</h1>", "<h2>$R{resourceTitle}</h2>" } )

        Equivalent to calling RestInfoProvider.getSiteName(RestRequest) with this object.

        Returns:
        The localized site name.
        Throws:
        RestException
        InternalServerError

        Returns the localized resource title.

      • getHttpMethod

        public HttpMethod getHttpMethod()
        Returns the HTTP 1.1 method name of the request as an enum.

        Note that non-RFC2616 method names resolve as HttpMethod.OTHER.

        Returns:
        The HTTP method.

      • isPlainText

        public boolean isPlainText()
        Returns true if &plainText=true was specified as a URL parameter.

        This indicates that the Content-Type of the output should always be set to "text/plain" to make it easy to render in a browser.

        This feature is useful for debugging.

        Returns:
        true if &amp;plainText=true was specified as a URL parameter

      • getMessageBundle

        public MessageBundle getMessageBundle()
        Returns the resource bundle for the request locale.
        Example:

        @RestMethod(...) public String sayHello(RestRequest req, @Query("user") String user) { // Get message bundle. MessageBundle mb = req.getMessageBundle(); // Return a localized message. return mb.getString("hello.message", user); }

        Notes:
        • The MessageBundle object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_messages
        • getMessage(String,Object...)
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > Messages
        Returns:
        The resource bundle.
        Never null.

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage(String key,
                         Object... args)
        Shortcut method for calling MessageBundle.getString(Locale, String, Object...) based on the request locale.
        Parameters:
        key - The message key.
        args - Optional MessageFormat-style arguments.
        Returns:
        The localized message.

      • getContext

        public RestContext getContext()
        Returns the resource context handling the request.

        Can be used to access servlet-init parameters or annotations during requests, such as in calls to RestGuard.guard(RestRequest, RestResponse)..

        Returns:
        The resource context handling the request.

      • getJavaMethod

        public Method getJavaMethod()
        Returns the java method handling the request.

        Can be used to access the method name or method annotations during requests, such as in calls to RestGuard.guard(RestRequest, RestResponse).

        Notes:
        • This returns null when evaluating servlet-level guards since the method has not been resolved at that point of execution.
        Returns:
        The Java method handling the request, or null if the method has not yet been resolved.

      • getBeanSession

        public BeanSession getBeanSession()
        Returns the BeanSession associated with this request.
        Returns:
        The request bean session.

      • isDebug

        public boolean isDebug()
        Returns true if debug mode is enabled. Debug mode is enabled by simply adding "?debug=true" to the query string or adding a Debug: true header on the request.
        Returns:
        true if debug mode is enabled.

      • getVarResolverSession

        public VarResolverSession getVarResolverSession()
        Request-level variable resolver session.

        Used to resolve SVL variables in text.

        Example:

        @RestMethod(...) public String sayHello(RestRequest req) { // Get var resolver session. VarResolverSession session = getVarResolverSession(); // Use it to construct a customized message from a query parameter. return session.resolve("Hello $RQ{user}!"); }

        Notes:
        • The VarResolverSession object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
        See Also:
        • RestContext.getVarResolver()
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > SVL Variables
        Returns:
        The variable resolver for this request.

      • getClasspathReaderResource

        public ReaderResource getClasspathReaderResource(String name,
                                                 boolean resolveVars,
                                                 MediaType mediaType,
                                                 boolean cached)
                                          throws IOException
        Returns an instance of a ReaderResource that represents the contents of a resource text file from the classpath.

        Example:

        // A rest method that (unsafely!) returns the contents of a localized file // from the classpath and resolves any SVL variables embedded in it. @RestMethod(...) public String myMethod(RestRequest req, @Query("file") String file) { return req.getClasspathResourceAsString(file, true); }

        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_classpathResourceFinder
        • getClasspathReaderResource(String, boolean)
        • getClasspathReaderResource(String)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource (i.e. the value normally passed to Class.getResourceAsStream(String).
        resolveVars - If true, any SVL variables will be resolved by the variable resolver returned by getVarResolverSession().
        See RestContext.getVarResolver() for the list of supported variables.
        mediaType - The value to set as the "Content-Type" header for this object.
        cached - If true, the resource will be read into a byte array for fast serialization.
        Returns:
        A new reader resource, or null if resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getClasspathReaderResource

        public ReaderResource getClasspathReaderResource(String name,
                                                 boolean resolveVars)
                                          throws IOException
        Same as getClasspathReaderResource(String, boolean, MediaType, boolean) except uses the resource mime-type map constructed using RestContextBuilder.mimeTypes(String...) to determine the media type.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource (i.e. the value normally passed to Class.getResourceAsStream(String).
        resolveVars - If true, any SVL variables will be resolved by the variable resolver returned by getVarResolverSession().
        See RestContext.getVarResolver() for the list of supported variables.
        Returns:
        A new reader resource, or null if resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getClasspathReaderResource

        public ReaderResource getClasspathReaderResource(String name)
                                          throws IOException
        Same as getClasspathReaderResource(String, boolean) with resolveVars == false
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource (i.e. the value normally passed to Class.getResourceAsStream(String).
        Returns:
        A new reader resource, or null if resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getClasspathStreamResource

        public StreamResource getClasspathStreamResource(String name,
                                                 MediaType mediaType,
                                                 boolean cached)
                                          throws IOException
        Returns an instance of a StreamResource that represents the contents of a resource binary file from the classpath.
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_classpathResourceFinder
        • getClasspathStreamResource(String)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource (i.e. the value normally passed to Class.getResourceAsStream(String).
        mediaType - The value to set as the "Content-Type" header for this object.
        cached - If true, the resource will be read into a byte array for fast serialization.
        Returns:
        A new stream resource, or null if resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getClasspathStreamResource

        public StreamResource getClasspathStreamResource(String name)
                                          throws IOException
        Same as getClasspathStreamResource(String, MediaType, boolean) except uses the resource mime-type map constructed using RestContextBuilder.mimeTypes(String...) to determine the media type.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource (i.e. the value normally passed to Class.getResourceAsStream(String).
        Returns:
        A new stream resource, or null if resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getConfig

        public Config getConfig()
        Config file associated with the resource.

        Returns a config file with session-level variable resolution. The config file is identified via one of the following:

        • RestResource.config()
        • RestContextBuilder.config(Config)
        Example:

        @RestMethod(...) public void doGet(RestRequest req) { // Get config file. Config cf = req.getConfig(); // Get simple values from config file. int timeout = cf.getInt("MyResource/timeout", 10000); // Get complex values from config file. MyBean b = cf.getObject("MyResource/myBean", MyBean.class); }

        Notes:
        • The Config object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
        See Also:
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > Configuration Files
        Returns:
        The config file associated with the resource, or null if resource does not have a config file associated with it.

      • getWidgets

        public Map<String,Widget> getWidgets()
        Returns the widgets used for resolving "$W{...}" string variables.
        Returns:
        The widgets used for resolving "$W{...}" string variables. Never null.

      • getRequest

        public <T> T getRequest(Class<T> c)
        Creates a proxy interface to retrieve HTTP parts of this request as a proxy bean.
        Examples:

        @RestMethod(path="/mypath/{p1}/{p2}/*") public void myMethod(@Request MyRequest rb) {...} public interface MyRequest { @Path // Path variable name inferred from getter. String getP1(); @Path("p2") String getX(); @Path("/*") String getRemainder(); @Query String getQ1(); // Schema-based query parameter: Pipe-delimited lists of comma-delimited lists of integers. @Query( collectionFormat="pipes" items=@Items( items=@SubItems( collectionFormat="csv" type="integer" ) ) ) int[][] getQ3(); @Header("*") Map<String,Object> getHeaders();

        Parameters:
        c - The request bean interface to instantiate.
        Returns:
        A new request bean proxy for this REST request.

      • getRequest

        public <T> T getRequest(RequestBeanMeta rbm)
        Same as getRequest(Class) but used on pre-instantiated RequestBeanMeta objects.
        Parameters:
        rbm - The metadata about the request bean interface to create.
        Returns:
        A new request bean proxy for this REST request.

      • getLogger

        public RestLogger getLogger()
        Logger.

        Shortcut for calling getContext().getLogger().

        Example:

        @RestMethod(...) public void doGet(RestRequest req) { req.getLogger().logObjects(FINE, "Request query parameters = {0}", req.getQuery()); }

        Notes:
        • The RestLogger object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
        See Also:
        • RestContext.REST_logger
        • RestLogger
        • RestServlet.log(Level, String, Object...)
        • RestServlet.logObjects(Level, String, Object...)
        • Overview > juneau-rest-server > Logging and Error Handling
        Returns:
        The logger associated with the resource context.
        Never null.

        Parameters:
        o - The response POJO.
        Returns:
        Metadata about the specified response object, or null if it's not annotated with @Response.
